sen.j: 尾上 松之助（おのえ まつのすけ、1875年（明治9年）9月12日 - 1926年（大正15年）9月11日）は明治時代から大正時代にかけての日本の映画俳優、日本最初の映画スター、映画監督である。
sen.e: Matsunosuke ONOE (September 12, 1875 - September 11, 1926) was a Japanese film actor, Japan's first movie star and film director from the Meiji to the Taisho period.
Matsunosuke ONOE (September 12, 1875 - September 11, 1926) was a Japanese film actor, Japan's first movie star and film director from the Meiji to the Taisho period.
Matsunosuke ONOE (September 12, 1875 - September 11, 1926) was a Japanese film actor, Japan's first movie star and film director from the Meiji to the Taisho period.

sen.j: 本名は中村鶴三（なかむら かくぞう）。
sen.e: His real name was Kakuzo NAKAMURA.
His real name was Kakuzo NAKAMURA.
His real name was Kakuzo NAKAMURA.

sen.j: 1875年（明治9年）9月12日（一説には9月11日生まれ）、岡山県岡山市北区 (岡山市)中島田に岡山県士族の子として生まれた。
sen.e: On September 12 (or September 11) 1875 Matsunosuke ONOE was born as a son of a samurai family in Okayama Prefecture in Nakashimada, Kita Ward (in Okayama City), Okayama City, Okayama Prefecture.
On September 12 (or September 11) 1875 Matsunosuke ONOE was born as a son of a samurai family in Okayama Prefecture in Nakashimada, Kita Ward, Okayama City, Okayama Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 「(in Okayama City)」を記載の必要なしと判断し、削除しました。
sen.e: On September 12 (or September 11) 1875 Matsunosuke ONOE was born as a son of a samurai family in Okayama Prefecture in Nakashimada, Kita Ward, Okayama City, Okayama Prefecture.

sen.j: 幼少より芝居好き。
sen.e: As a child he loved the theatre.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As a child he loved the theatre.
As a child he loved the theatre.

sen.j: 6歳の時、関西歌舞伎の大立者・尾上多見蔵 (2代目)の後援を受けて実家近くの旭座で初舞台を踏む。
sen.e: He made his first stage debut at the Asahiza theatre near his house, supported by Tamizo ONOE (II), a prominent actor in Kansai Kabuki when he was six years old.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He made his first stage debut at the Asahiza theatre near his house, supported by Tamizo ONOE (II), a prominent actor in Kansai Kabuki when he was six years old.
He made his first stage debut at the Asahiza theatre near his house, supported by Tamizo ONOE (II), a prominent actor in Kansai Kabuki when he was six years old.

sen.j: （この頃の芸名は尾上多雀ないし多見雀）。
sen.e: (His then stage name was Tajaku or Tamijaku ONOE).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: (His then stage name was Tajaku or Tamijaku ONOE).
(His then stage name was Tajaku or Tamijaku ONOE).

sen.j: 18歳の頃、尾上鶴三郎あるいは三升源五郎の名で芝居一座の座長として中国地方や四国を巡業した。
sen.e: By the name of Kakusaburo ONOE or Gengoro MIMASU, he toured around Chugoku and Shikoku region as leader of the troupe when he was 18 years old.
By the name of Kakusaburo ONOE or Gengoro MIMASU, he toured around Chugoku and Shikoku region as leader of the troupe when he was 18 years old.
By the name of Kakusaburo ONOE or Gengoro MIMASU, he toured around Chugoku and Shikoku region as leader of the troupe when he was 18 years old.

sen.j: 1902年（明治35年）に行われた九州巡業の時、2代目尾上松之助を襲名した。
sen.e: He assumed the stage name of Matsunosuke ONOE II while he was touring in Kyushu in 1902.
He assumed the stage name of Matsunosuke ONOE II while he was touring in Kyushu in 1902.
He assumed the stage name of Matsunosuke ONOE II while he was touring in Kyushu in 1902.

sen.j: 1904年（明治37年）に岡山県笠岡市での公演中、京都市上京区で千本座の座主を務める牧野省三と出会う。
sen.e: In 1904 he met Shozo MAKINO, manager of Senbonza Theater located in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City during his tour in Kasaoka City, Okayama Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1904 he met Shozo MAKINO, manager of Senbonza Theater located in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City during his tour in Kasaoka City, Okayama Prefecture.
In 1904 he met Shozo MAKINO, manager of Senbonza Theater located in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City during his tour in Kasaoka City, Okayama Prefecture.

sen.j: 映画進出を勧められた。
sen.e: He was encouraged to become a film actor.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was encouraged to become a film actor.
He was encouraged to become a film actor.

sen.j: 牧野は松之助のきびきびした演技やケレンの巧さに目をつけ、映画出演を持ちかけた。
sen.e: Taking note of his crisp performance and skilful 'keren' (playing to the gallery). Makino offered him a part in a movie.
Taking note of his crisp performance and skilful 'keren' (playing to the gallery). Makino offered him a part in a movie.
Taking note of his crisp performance and skilful 'keren' (playing to the gallery), Makino offered him a part in a movie.
sen.cmt: カンマに変更しました。

sen.j: 1909年（明治42年）、横田商会制作・牧野監督の『碁盤忠信』（ごばんただのぶ）に主演し映画デビューを果たした。
sen.e: In 1909 Matsunosuke made his film debut, starring in "Tadanobu GOBAN" produced by Yokota Shokai and directed by Makino.
In 1909 Matsunosuke made his film debut, starring in "Tadanobu GOBAN" produced by Yokota Shokai and directed by Makino.
In 1909 Matsunosuke made his film debut, starring in "Tadanobu GOBAN" produced by Yokota Shokai and directed by Makino.

sen.j: 目を見開き見得を切る演技で「目玉の松ちゃん」の愛称で親しまれた。
sen.e: Opening his eyes as wide as possible and taking a 'mie' pose, he was fondly called 'Medama no Matchan' (Matsu with popping eyes).
Opening his eyes as wide as possible and taking a 'mie' pose, he was fondly called 'Medama no Matchan' (Matsu with popping eyes).
Opening his eyes as wide as possible and taking a 'mie' pose, he was fondly called 'Medama no Matchan' (Matsu with popping eyes).

sen.j: 生涯に横田商会（のち合併により日活）が制作した1,000本以上の時代劇映画に出演した。
sen.e: He appeared in over 1,000 period movies produced by Yokota Shokai (later consolidated into Nikkatsu) in his lifetime.
He appeared in over 1,000 period movies produced by Yokota Shokai (later consolidated into Nikkatsu) in his lifetime.
He appeared in over 1,000 period movies produced by Yokota Shokai (later consolidated into Nikkatsu) in his lifetime.

sen.j: 日本映画草創期に活躍した邦画第1号の映画大スターであった。
sen.e: He was the first great movie star in Japanese cinema at its inception.
He was the first great movie star in Japanese cinema at its inception.
He was the first great movie star in Japanese cinema at its inception.

sen.j: また俳優業の傍ら制作、監督も務めた。
sen.e: While continuing with his acting, he also produced and directed films.
While continuing with his acting, he also produced and directed films.
While continuing with his acting, he also produced and directed films.

sen.j: 慈善事業も行い、貧しい人たちのためにポケットマネーで長屋を京都市内に建てた。
sen.e: He was also a philanthropist, constructing a nagaya (long) house for the poor in Kyoto City with his own money.
He was also a philanthropist, constructing a nagaya (long) house for the poor in Kyoto City with his own money.
He was also a philanthropist, constructing a nagaya (long) house for the poor in Kyoto City with his own money.

sen.j: 松之助は晩年日活の重役となる。
sen.e: Later in his life he became an executive of Nikkatsu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Later in his life he became an executive of Nikkatsu.
Later in his life he became an executive of Nikkatsu.

sen.j: 歌舞伎の英雄豪傑を舞台そのままに演じた古風な映画を制作した。
sen.e: He produced the old-fashioned movies that faithfully reflected the kabuki stage with heroic figures.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He produced the old-fashioned movies that faithfully reflected the kabuki stage with heroic figures.
He produced the old-fashioned movies that faithfully reflected the kabuki stage with heroic figures.

sen.j: だが、アメリカ合衆国からの本格的な活劇やその影響を受けた阪東妻三郎の映画などに押されはじめた。
sen.e: Yet his works were beginning to be eclipsed by real American action movies and Tsumasaburo BANDO's cinema influenced by the latter.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Yet his works were beginning to be eclipsed by real American action movies and Tsumasaburo BANDO's cinema influenced by the latter.
Yet his works were beginning to be eclipsed by real American action movies and Tsumasaburo BANDO's cinema influenced by the latter.

sen.j: 1925年（大正14年）の主演1000本記念大作の『荒木又右衛門』はそのような状況で製作された。
sen.e: In such a situation he produced "Mataemon ARAKI," a big movie celebrating his 1,000th lead role in 1925.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In such a situation he produced "Mataemon ARAKI," a big movie celebrating his 1,000th lead role in 1925.
In such a situation he produced "Mataemon ARAKI," a big movie celebrating his 1,000th lead role in 1925.

sen.j: 従来の歌舞伎調の立ちまわりを脱しリアルな殺陣を演じ大ヒットして気を吐いた。
sen.e: The movie was a great hit and made a good showing, introducing realistic rather than traditional kabuki-like sword-fighting scenes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The movie was a great hit and made a good showing, introducing realistic rather than traditional kabuki-like sword-fighting scenes.
The movie was a great hit and made a good showing, introducing realistic rather than traditional kabuki-like sword-fighting scenes.

sen.j: 1926年（大正15年）、『侠骨三日月』の撮影中に倒れる。
sen.e: In 1926 he collapsed while filming "Kyokotsu Mikazuki."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1926 he collapsed while filming "Kyokotsu Mikazuki."
In 1926 he collapsed while filming "Kyokotsu Mikazuki."

sen.j: 9月11日、心臓病のため死去。
sen.e: On September 11 he died of heart failure.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On September 11 he died of heart failure.
On September 11 he died of heart failure.

sen.j: 享年52。
sen.e: He was 52 years old.
He was 52 years old.
He was 52 years old.

sen.j: 京都市内で行われた葬儀は京都府知事をはじめ参列者5万人、葬列の沿道は20万人にも及ぶ市民で埋め尽くされたと当時の記録に残されている。
sen.e: It has been chronicled that 50,000 people including the governor of Kyoto Prefecture attended his funeral held in Kyoto City and over 200,000 citizens crowded the roadsides to watch the funeral procession.

It has been chronicled that 50,000 people including the governor of Kyoto Prefecture attended his funeral held in Kyoto City and over 200,000 citizens crowded the roadsides to watch the funeral procession.

It has been chronicled that 50,000 people including the governor of Kyoto Prefecture attended his funeral held in Kyoto City and over 200,000 citizens crowded the roadsides to watch the funeral procession.

sen.j: 大衆に映画を新しい娯楽として根付かせた功績はあまりにも大きい。
sen.e: His achievements in establishing cinema as popular entertainment are all too great.
His achievements in establishing cinema as popular entertainment are all too great.
His achievements in establishing cinema as popular entertainment are all too great.
